page.title: 04WALKINGTON;POST,PHONES&CLUBS
page.content: THERE ARE TWO POST BOXES IN OUR AREA EACH EMPTIED TWICE ON WEEKDAYS,ONCE ON SATURDAY BUT NOT ON SUNDAY.OUR MAIL IS TAKEN TO BEVERLEY AND FROM THERE TO HULL FOR SORTING.POST IS DELIVERED TO OUR HOMES ONCE A DAY EXCEPT SUNDAY;THE SQUARE BEING COVERED BY TWO POSTMEN IN VANS,NOT WALKING. RESIDENTS OF WALKINGTON ARE CONNECTED TO HULL INDEPENDENT TELEPHONE SYSTEM, BUT THE FARMS OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE ARE ON THE NATIONAL NETWORK. CLUBS EXIST IN WALKINGTON FOR PEOPLE FROM AGE 6 TO OLD AGE PENSIONERS.THESE ARE BEAVERS,CUBS AND SCOUTS FOR BOYS; BROWNIES,GUIDES AND RANGERS FOR GIRLS, AND YOUTH CLUB FOR BOTH,ALL OF WHICH MEET WEEKLY.WALKINGTON WIVES AND YORKSHIRE COUNTRYWOMEN ARE MONTHLY LADIES ORGANISATIONS,WHILE THE DARBY AND JOAN CLUB,MEETING EVERY TWO WEEKS, IS FOR OLD AGE PENSIONERS.
